short_reason: CON wins through superior clash and weighing. CON effectively dismantled PRO's core claim that audits can be separated from data exposure, arguing algorithms are 'inextricably linked' to user data. CON's distinction between dynamic algorithms and static financial audits went largely unaddressed. CON provided clearer comparative weighing by framing tangible privacy/IP harms against unproven transparency benefits, while PRO's weighing remained more assertive than analytical.
